[T1113-Screen Capture]

[Solution One Unit Test]
import pyautogui

def test_capture_screen():
    # Perform the screen capture
    capture_screen()
    
    # Check if the screenshot is saved as expected
    assert os.path.isfile('screenshot.png') == True

test_capture_screen()

[Solution Two Unit Test]
from PIL import Image

def test_capture_screen():
    # Perform the screen capture
    capture_screen()
    
    # Check if the screenshot is saved as expected
    assert os.path.isfile('screenshot.png') == True
    
    # Open the saved screenshot and check its validity
    screenshot = Image.open('screenshot.png')
    screenshot.verify()

test_capture_screen()

[Solution Three Unit Test]
from pygetwindow import getAllTitles

def test_capture_screen():
    # Perform the screen capture
    capture_screen()
    
    # Check if the screenshot is saved as expected
    assert os.path.isfile('screenshot.png') == True
    
    # Check if 'Desktop' window title is present in the captured screenshot
    assert 'Desktop' in getAllTitles()

test_capture_screen()
